result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven D Gaston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Maintain full time work and/or school.
No contact with Tracy R. and David R.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven D Gaston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney James Robert Daniel Rael in court.  Student Intern Patrick O'Keefe under the supervision ofAlex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  
Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit of 1 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Anger management course.
*Maintain full time work and/or school.
*No Contact with Tracy R. and David R. 
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant Steven D Gaston in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   OCCR Tape#15-100
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/26/15 @ 1:30 pm
